programme.title: Baggage Battles
programme.desc: Space Case. The baggage battlers head to a government auction in Sacramento, California. Mark Meyer cuts into the Martin's profit by bidding high on a box of knives. S3, Ep6

programme.title: Baggage Battles
programme.desc: Two-Faced. The baggage battlers head to a police auction in Stockton, California, where one of the auction specialists discover a mask mould of a famous Hollywood icon. S3, Ep7

programme.title: Baggage Battles
programme.desc: Guns a-Blazin'. The baggage battlers head to a cowboy auction in California, where they duel over items dating back to the legendary Buffalo Bill and the Barnum & Bailey circuses. S3, Ep8

programme.title: Baggage Battles
programme.desc: Platinum Hits. The baggage battlers head to a music icons auction in New York. They find a gold disc for the Pink Floyd album 'Dark Side Of The Moon' and a nude photo of Madonna. S3, Ep9

programme.title: Junkyard Empire

programme.title: Junkyard Empire
programme.desc: You Say Trash, I Say Tank. Andy loves a challenge. So when he agrees to a paintball tank build and to a bet with his father over a pickup truck at the same time, it's game on. S2, Ep2

programme.title: Junkyard Empire
programme.desc: Build a Jeep, Crush a Car. Andy's drive to grow his business pushes him to take on more work than he can handle. With problems mounting, he leans on his team of seasoned techs. S2, Ep3

programme.title: Junkyard Empire
programme.desc: Hot Wheelin' And Dealin'. When iconic car designer Larry Wood asks Andy to build him a life-size replica of one of his Hot Wheel designs, Andy sees it as the build of a lifetime. S2, Ep4

programme.title: Kindig Customs
programme.desc: The Last Frontier Cuda. A road warrior from Alaska arrives to add some improvements to an already solid build. To enhance performance, a new exhaust and tips are custom fabricated. S6, Ep5

programme.title: Kindig Customs
programme.desc: Cut, Replace, Repeat. A simple yet classy Pontiac Tempest arrives for a ground-up build. But after the car is completely stripped, things get complicated. S6, Ep6

programme.title: Iron Resurrection

programme.title: Junior Bake Off
programme.desc: In this compilation episode, the finalists bake Stone Age rock cakes, magnificent moments in history biscuits and best-ever birthday cakes. Who'll be crowned the winner?

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Roommate Transmogrification: Raj decides to move in with Sheldon after hearing Leonard and Priya engaging in a Star Trek bedroom fantasy.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Skank Reflex Analysis: Penny worries that she's screwed things up with her friends after her night with Raj. Sheldon takes command of the paintball team.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Infestation Hypothesis: Amy is stuck in the middle of a battle of wills between Penny and Sheldon. Leonard and Priya try to spice up their long-distance relationship.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Pulled Groin Extrapolation: Leonard goes to a colleague's wedding as Amy's date. Howard tries to convince Bernadette to live with his mum after they get married.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Wiggly Finger Catalyst: Raj begins to get upset that he's the only one of the four guys not in a relationship, so Penny sets out to find him the perfect date.

programme.title: Home Alone
programme.desc: (1990) Classic family comedy starring Macaulay Culkin. A boy's parents forget to take him on holiday with them. Then two inept burglars turn up. Can our resourceful young hero outwit them?

programme.title: New: Lego Masters Australia
programme.desc: Brand new series - What's on the Box?: From SpongeBob to Baywatch, the six teams recreate an instantly recognisable scene from an iconic TV show. But who'll be a ratings flop?

programme.title: The Simpsons Go Back to School
programme.desc: The Secret War of Lisa Simpson: Bart and Lisa enrol in military school, but Lisa finds it hard to fit in. Guest starring Willem Dafoe.

programme.title: The Simpsons Go Back to School
programme.desc: My Fair Laddy: Lisa tries to transform Groundskeeper Willie into a gentleman after his shack collapses and he's forced to move in with the Simpsons.

programme.title: The Simpsons Go Back to School
programme.desc: Brother's Little Helper: An experimental ADHD drug improves Bart's behaviour but makes him paranoid: is Major League Baseball using a satellite to read his thoughts?

programme.title: The Simpsons Go Back to School
programme.desc: The Monkey Suit: Ned is horrified by an evolution exhibition and asks Reverend Lovejoy to promote creationism. So Lisa arranges secret evolution classes...

programme.title: The Simpsons Go Back to School
programme.desc: Bart vs. Lisa vs. the Third Grade: Bart is held back a year at school and Lisa is moved up into the same class as him.

programme.title: Venom: Let There Be Carnage
programme.desc: (2021) Tom Hardy returns as Marvel's gnarly antihero, to face a symbiote spawned from Venom's own blood living inside a serial killer who looks just like Woody Harrelson. Yikes.

programme.title: Open House: The Great Sex...
programme.desc: ...Experiment: Jess and Ben explore a non-monogamous lifestyle in the hot tub with Olivia and Gage, where Jess faces a big fear. And Kirsty and Tom consider attending a huge orgy.

programme.title: Seriously Red
programme.desc: (2022) Krew Boylan's musical comedy romance about a lost-in-life young woman who finds her way by impersonating the mighty Dolly Parton. But how far should she tread that glittering path?

programme.title: Wild Card
programme.desc: (2015) Sin City thriller with Jason Statham. A compulsive gambler who does favours for money just wants out of the Vegas life. Just one big win at the tables should do it...

programme.title: Thief
programme.desc: (1971) Crime thriller starring Richard Crenna. A recently paroled thief must do one last job to pay off old debts. But can he get away with it and build a life with his new girlfriend?

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: (2020) Madcap adventure-comedy video game adaptation with Jim Carrey and Ben Schwartz. Can nippy ring-chasing hedgehog Sonic escape the clutches of an evil, moustachioed scientist?

programme.title: Playing with Fire
programme.desc: (2019) Fun-filled family comedy starring John Cena. A macho fireman has to babysit three impish kids after saving them from a blaze in the remote California woodlands.

programme.title: Broken Arrow
programme.desc: (1950) Western starring James Stewart. A gold prospector, tired of reprisal killings between whites and Native Americans, offers a truce to the Apaches' leader. But tensions resurface.

programme.title: Operation Petticoat
programme.desc: (1959) Second World War comedy. Tony Curtis and Cary Grant play members of the crew of a submarine that's painted bright pink just as the Japanese launch their assault in the Pacific.

programme.title: Taxi
programme.desc: (2004) All-action thriller. Queen Latifah stars as the driver of the fastest taxi in New York, who teams up with an inept cop (Jimmy Fallon) to catch a team of female bank-robbers.

programme.title: Monster Hunter
programme.desc: (2020) Paul WS Anderson's sci-fi action starring Milla Jovovich, based on the game of the same name. A US Army Ranger must fight her way out of a parallel world full of monsters.

programme.title: Underwater
programme.desc: (2020) Sci-fi horror with Kristen Stewart. Disaster strikes at an underwater facility when seabed drilling causes an earthquake, drawing the attention of a lurking menace.

programme.title: Gaia
programme.desc: (2021) Eco-horror. An injured woman is taken by two survivalists to their rainforest hut. But the real threat lurks outside, creeping beneath the forest floor mostly unseen, but familiar...

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Land that Time Forgot
programme.desc: (1974) Fantasy adventure about survivors from a torpedoed First World War ship who end up in a legendary land in the Atlantic where dinosaurs roam. With Doug McClure.

programme.title: The Muppets Take Manhattan
programme.desc: (1984) It's time to put on make-up. It's time to light the lights. Kermit, Miss Piggy, Fozzy, the Blues one and the gang embark on a musical adventure as they try to make it on Broadway.

programme.title: The Call of the Wild
programme.desc: (2020) Touching adventure with Harrison Ford, based on Jack London's classic novel. A big, friendly hound finds himself unwittingly travelling across late 19th-century North America.

programme.title: The Art of Racing in the Rain
programme.desc: (2019) Touching comedy-drama. An ageing golden retriever (voiced by Kevin Costner) tells the story of his life with his best pal, a budding Formula 1 driver.

programme.title: The Day After Tomorrow
programme.desc: (2004) Tense sci-fi thriller starring Jake Gyllenhaal and Dennis Quaid. A scientist sets out to save his son when global warming plunges the world into a sudden climatic catastrophe.

programme.title: Titanic
programme.desc: (1997) Leonardo DiCaprio and Kate Winslet star in James Cameron's Oscar-winning epic. Lovers from across the social divide meet on the doomed luxury liner.

programme.title: The Empty Man
programme.desc: (2020) Supernatural horror about a deadly ghoul that can be conjured by blowing across an empty bottle on an empty bridge. Can a world-weary ex-cop stop the apparently inevitable bloodshed?

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Patrick
programme.desc: (2018) Feel-good British family comedy. Sarah's (Beattie Edmondson) chaotic life gets even more complicated when she inherits a naughty pug from her nan.

programme.title: Muppets from Space
programme.desc: (1999) The Muppets are back in another feature-length adventure as Gonzo, convinced that he is of alien origin, struggles to communicate with his family in outer space.

programme.title: Mr Popper's Penguins
programme.desc: (2011) Family comedy. Jim Carrey stars as a work-obsessed New York property developer whose life is turned upside down when he receives a crate containing six live penguins.

programme.title: First Knight
programme.desc: (1995) Romantic drama based on Arthurian legend, starring Richard Gere, Sean Connery and Julia Ormond. Can nomadic swordsman Lancelot contain his love for King Arthur's fiancée?

programme.title: Django Unchained Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Quentin Tarantino and stars Samuel L Jackson, Christoph Waltz, Jamie Foxx and Kerry Washington talk about making the western adventure set against a backdrop of slavery.

programme.title: The Old Man and the Gun
programme.desc: (2018) Crime biopic. Robert Redford stars as charming 74-year-old robber Forrest Tucker. He's still robbing banks when he falls for farmer Jewel (Sissy Spacek). But the cops still want him.

programme.title: Flamin' Hot
programme.desc: (2023) Eva Longoria directs the real-life story of Richard Montañez - the Latino janitor who invented Flamin' Hot Cheetos, aka the 'world's most popular snack'. Starring Jesse Garcia.

programme.title: Meet the Fockers
programme.desc: (2004) Comedy sequel. What happens when an ex-CIA prude and ageing, sexually liberated hippies become in-laws? Robert De Niro, Barbara Streisand and Dustin Hoffman show you what happens.

programme.title: Beast
programme.desc: (2022) Thrilling romp starring Idris Elba as an all-action doctor who must protect his family from a man-slaying lion in the wilds of South Africa, armed with a jeep and a keen right hook.

programme.title: Seriously Red
programme.desc: (2022) Krew Boylan's musical comedy romance about a lost-in-life young woman who finds her way by impersonating the mighty Dolly Parton. But how far should she tread that glittering path?

programme.desc: Join Patrick for two hours of spirited debate and news making interviews. Top guests tackle the issues that matter, with a sharp take on every story.

programme.desc: Tomorrow's news, tonight. All the major stories making the front pages and full coverage of all the breaking news at home and abroad with Patrick Christys.

programme.title: Farage
programme.desc: Nigel Farage doesn't hold back in his GB News prime-time show. Hear his views and give your own in an hour of discussion and debate. Join Nigel as he takes on the big stories other media won't touch.

programme.desc: Join Jacob for his unique and unmissable take on the day's news.

programme.desc: Ben and Nana present every Friday morning. When the news happens, it happens here. But what does it mean for you? GB News brings you the biggest stories and the answers you need from across the UK.

programme.desc: Tackling the big stories from all angles and perspectives. Weekdays from midday, Tom Harwood and Dawn Neesom bring you the most compelling stories from across the United Kingdom.

programme.desc: Join Martin for an up-to-the-minute take on the day's events delivered in his own unique and lively style.

programme.title: The Fortune Hotel
programme.desc: The four remaining pairs face a Hotel Game with a twist that sees them targeting one another with daggers, but only if they can answer revealing questions about their rivals. The Day Trip Challenge sees one player from each pair imprisoned in a historic fort. They rely on their partner's communication skills to escape by solving symbol-based clues and racing to unlock their chained-up briefcases. Stephen Mangan hosts

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty and Shivi Ramoutar are joined by 2016 Great British Bake Off winner Candice Brown for a baked breakfast of a berry slump. Jimmy meets Charles the iguana while he is out for a walk at the wildlife park, and Suffolk local Nicola gives a masterclass in fermenting by showing some unusual combinations

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Guest panellists engage in topical debate and celebrity interviews from a female perspective

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: Fern Britton: Inside the Vet's
programme.desc: Vet James is concerned about British Shorthair cat Nico as he has a limp in his hind legs. Fern meets Cocker Spaniel Nya as she enters the surgery for a scan on a potentially cancerous lump. Vet Amy performs a delicate operation on Border Terrier Dobby, and cameras follow puppies in training at Bristol's Guide Dog Centre

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Welsh mother and son team Aly and Jarrod, Lincoln housemates Hannah and Jess, and West Sussex married couple Suzanne and Ed try to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. Presented by Adil Ray

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Jaz from Birmingham, Lynn from Huntingdon, Ciara from Burnley and Steve from St Helens pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: What's on Scotland
programme.desc: Movie news, chat about favourite TV programmes, and music. Plus, catch-ups with some of the biggest names in worldwide entertainment

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Charity crumbles under the weight of everything, while Aaron makes a shocking discovery and Moira has a new friend

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Tracy winds up Abi by propositioning Carl, a hungover Asha calls in sick, Jenny stares death in the face, Miles turns up at Summer's birthday party, and Theo orders Todd to choose between him and Billy

programme.title: The Fortune Hotel
programme.desc: The final Hotel Game sees guests scramble to solve a devious puzzle in their rooms, and the final three pairs race across the Caribbean Sea in the Day Trip Challenge. Back at the hotel, the air is thick with tension as the last Night Cap begins - with only one pair set to check out with the fortune, every decision is vital. Stephen Mangan hosts

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: The Taking of Pelham 123
programme.desc: Denzel Washington and John Travolta star in this remake of the 1974 thriller. An armed gang holds passengers on a New York subway train hostage, and threatens to start killing them unless they receive a huge ransom. As the minutes tick by, the tense situation becomes a battle of wits between gang leader "Ryder" and train dispatcher Walter Garber.

programme.title: The Fortune Hotel
programme.desc: The final Hotel Game sees guests scramble to solve a devious puzzle in their rooms, and the final three pairs race across the Caribbean Sea in the Day Trip Challenge. Back at the hotel, the air is thick with tension as the last Night Cap begins - with only one pair set to check out with the fortune, every decision is vital. Stephen Mangan hosts

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Join Katie Piper and enter the space she's created as a one-stop shop for wellness needs, fitness, food, entertainment, celebrity access, local community heroes and much more.

programme.title: Simply Raymond Blanc
programme.desc: The chef shares recipe ideas for breakfast and brunch, baking the perfect granola bar and showing how to make omelettes in three ways. Fellow chef Paul Ainsworth stops by to create an indulgent croque madame

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Jaz from Birmingham, Lynn from Huntingdon, Ciara from Burnley and Steve from St Helens pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Cooking with the Stars
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Tom Allen host as Natalie Cassidy, Jack Osbourne and Kelly Hoppen try to impress with family favourite dishes in a three-way cooking battle. The second contest sees Jordan North go up against Shaun Wright-Phillips in a bid to secure a place in the semi-final, with the stars who fail to impress heading into the dreaded cook-off

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty and Shivi Ramoutar are joined by singer Tony Hadley, who samples kipper and black pudding cakes. Jimmy meets Jay at the wildlife park as he is shearing one of the rams, a member of a local rescue centre chats about how to help hedgehogs and Max makes off-grid appliances sure to impress any campers

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined by Dead Ringers stars Jon Culshaw and Jan Ravens and Peter Wright from The Yorkshire Vet, while there are recipes from chefs Atul Kochhar and Lesley Waters

programme.title: Ainsley's Fantastic Flavours
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott explores the flavours of East Asia, making a spicy start to the show with his Korean chicken wings served with pickled radish, while Shivi Ramoutar whips up a speedy DIY ramen dish that kids will love. Radio presenter Sarah-Jane Crawford then cooks up a storm with her yaki soba before Ainsley's last dish of a refined miso, ginger and yuzu-glazed cod

programme.title: Tom Kerridge Cooks Spain
programme.desc: The chef's journey takes him to Catalonia in his bespoke vintage food truck, beginning on the Ebro Delta. Tom is set to work by Juan, a rice farmer who is also Spain's Strongest Man. He discovers the backbreaking work required to work in harmony with local birdlife. The host's journey then takes him to Lleida, the produce heartland of Catalonia, for what could be the first day of the donut peach season

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Sandown
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of a meeting headlined by the Solario Stakes from Sandown Park, plus racing from Beverley and Chester. With analysis from Leonna Mayor and Adele Mulrennan, reports by Oli Bell and Sally Ann Grassick, and commentary from Mark Johnson

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts: The Secrets of Dumbledore
programme.desc: Fantasy adventure sequel starring Eddie Redmayne, Jude Law and Mads Mikkelsen. Magizoologist Newt Scamander and his friends are recruited by Albus Dumbledore to stop the evil wizard Grindelwald's plans for world domination. The gang travels to Berlin, where Grindelwald and his acolytes are based, and where he proclaims war against the Muggles.

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.title: You Bet! on Tour
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern returns with the game show, this time travelling around the UK to find ordinary people taking on extraordinary challenges for the chance to win £5,000. Placing their bets are a revolving celebrity panel, which this edition features Alesha Dixon, Josie Gibson, and Josh Widdicombe

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Anton Du Beke and Fred Sirieix attempt to answer 15 questions correctly in the hope of winning one million pounds for charity. They have lifelines including Ask the Host, Phone a Friend and 50-50 available to them if they get stuck. Jeremy Clarkson hosts

programme.title: One Night
programme.desc: Believing Tess to be the author of One Night, Eden tracks her down and asks her about the crime at the heart of the novel. Confused by Eden's claims, Tess is horrified to realise that Simone has written an anonymous novel about the night she was sexually assaulted. Australian drama, starring Jodie Whittaker and Jillian Nguyen

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: English Football League Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the latest matches, including Middlesbrough v Sheffield United at Riverside Stadium, Millwall v Wrexham at The Den and Watford v Southampton at Vicarage Road in the Championship

programme.title: The Twelve
programme.desc: When the jurors are taken to Kate's house to observe a demonstration of the Crown's theory, it ends in disaster for the defence when someone tampers with Kate's studio. Back in the courtroom, an eyewitness testifies that he saw Kate out on the water at 4am the night Claire disappeared

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Fern Britton: Inside the Vet's
programme.desc: Fern meets a German Shorthaired Pointer puppy who has bitten off more than she can chew and helps vet James with Badger, a handsome but nervous cat who is in for a routine vaccination. Fern Britton presents the series where she meets the owners of beloved pets who have appointments at The Grove Vets. In this episode, Fern meets a German Shorthaired Pointer puppy who has bitten off more than she can chew and helps vet James with Badger, a handsome but nervous moggie who is in for a routine vaccination. Cameras also focus on clinical pet behaviourist Rosie Bescoby, who aims to bring harmony to a pair of warring hounds

programme.title: Simply Raymond Blanc
programme.desc: The chef shares recipes for his favourite dishes, including Swiss chard gratin, duck breast with marmalade, Vichy-style carrots and sweet potato, and artichoke barigoule. Former Le Manoir chef and old friend Ollie Dabbous visits Raymond in the kitchens and treats him to a special dish of candy-stripe beetroot salad with Sussex slipcote

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined by Dead Ringers stars Jon Culshaw and Jan Ravens and Peter Wright from The Yorkshire Vet, while there are recipes from chefs Atul Kochhar and Lesley Waters

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by comedian Babatunde Aléshé, Michael Douglas and Genevieve Turley transform a charity ambassador, and Lucy Pateman teaches Katie and Aldo Zilli about tablescaping

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Joining Alan this time are Dame Sheila Hancock, who discusses her stellar career, and actor Jeremy Swift to talk about Ted Lasso - we also celebrate the setter, one of our favourite dog breeds, Lesley Joseph goes on safari, and we have fun with rum!

programme.title: Ainsley's Fantastic Flavours
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott explores the flavours of East Asia, making a spicy start to the show with his Korean chicken wings served with pickled radish, while Shivi Ramoutar whips up a speedy DIY ramen dish that kids will love. Radio presenter Sarah-Jane Crawford then cooks up a storm with her yaki soba before Ainsley's last dish of a refined miso, ginger and yuzu-glazed cod

programme.title: Love Your Small Garden Special
programme.desc: In a special edition of the show, the team transform a narrow backyard in London for charity worker Maxine, and a tiny garden for a family of five in Kent. Throughout the programme, the team demonstrate that, with the right design, plants and a succession of tips, tricks, clever ideas, small outdoor spaces can be made to look and feel much bigger

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Adil Ray hosts the word game, which sees married couple Daphne and Peter from Bognor Regis, neighbours Sarah and Sarah from Wales and friends Charlie and Paige from Reading trying to find words from the fewest letters possible. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to potentially double the money they have won so far or leave with nothing

programme.title: A View to a Kill
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Roger Moore and Christopher Walken. James Bond is on the trail of industrialist Max Zorin after a duplicate of a top-secret British microchip is discovered. Zorin retaliates by unleashing his lethal assistant May Day to prevent 007 from sabotaging his evil plans.

programme.title: You Bet! on Tour
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern returns with the game show, this time travelling around the UK to find ordinary people taking on extraordinary challenges for the chance to win £5,000. Placing their bets are a revolving celebrity panel, which this edition features Alesha Dixon, Josie Gibson, and Josh Widdicombe

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Cooking with the Stars
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Tom Allen host as the remaining four famous faces compete in the semi-final as they take on healthy dishes. The two stars who fail to impress the judges will end up in the cook-off, with the pair fighting it out for the last place in the grand final

programme.title: Beat the Chasers
programme.desc: The Beast, The Governess, The Vixen, The Sinnerman, The Dark Destroyer and The Menace... they're the greatest quiz team that ever lived, but can anyone Beat the Chasers? Bradley Walsh hosts as we find out.

programme.title: I Fought the Law
programme.desc: In 1989, Ann Ming is distraught when her 22-year-old daughter Julie Hogg goes missing, but the police shrug off her concerns, suggesting that she must have fled to London to reunite with her estranged husband. Knowing in her heart that Julie would never leave her brother Kevin behind, Ann uncovers a mother's worst nightmare. Fact-based drama, starring Sheridan Smith

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: War for the Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: Sci-fi adventure sequel starring Woody Harrelson and Andy Serkis. In the third instalment of the rebooted franchise, ape leader Caesar embarks on a quest for revenge after the crazed Colonel McCullough kills Caesar's family in a bid to assassinate him.

programme.title: Dawn of the Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: Sci-fi adventure starring Gary Oldman, Jason Clarke and Andy Serkis. With most of the human population wiped out, the world is now ruled by super-intelligent apes. But their chimp leader Caesar finds his loyalties divided when a small band of human survivors strike back.

programme.title: The Fortune Hotel

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined by Dead Ringers stars Jon Culshaw and Jan Ravens and Peter Wright from The Yorkshire Vet, while there are recipes from chefs Atul Kochhar and Lesley Waters

programme.title: Ainsley's Fantastic Flavours
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott explores the flavours of East Asia, making a spicy start to the show with his Korean chicken wings served with pickled radish, while Shivi Ramoutar whips up a speedy DIY ramen dish that kids will love. Radio presenter Sarah-Jane Crawford then cooks up a storm with her yaki soba before Ainsley's last dish of a refined miso, ginger and yuzu-glazed cod

programme.title: Tom Kerridge Cooks Spain
programme.desc: The chef's journey takes him to Catalonia in his bespoke vintage food truck, beginning on the Ebro Delta. Tom is set to work by Juan, a rice farmer who is also Spain's Strongest Man. He discovers the backbreaking work required to work in harmony with local birdlife. The host's journey then takes him to Lleida, the produce heartland of Catalonia, for what could be the first day of the donut peach season

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Sandown
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of a meeting headlined by the Solario Stakes from Sandown Park, plus racing from Beverley and Chester. With analysis from Leonna Mayor and Adele Mulrennan, reports by Oli Bell and Sally Ann Grassick, and commentary from Mark Johnson

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts: The Secrets of Dumbledore
programme.desc: Fantasy adventure sequel starring Eddie Redmayne, Jude Law and Mads Mikkelsen. Magizoologist Newt Scamander and his friends are recruited by Albus Dumbledore to stop the evil wizard Grindelwald's plans for world domination. The gang travels to Berlin, where Grindelwald and his acolytes are based, and where he proclaims war against the Muggles.

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.title: You Bet! on Tour
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern returns with the game show, this time travelling around the UK to find ordinary people taking on extraordinary challenges for the chance to win £5,000. Placing their bets are a revolving celebrity panel, which this edition features Alesha Dixon, Josie Gibson, and Josh Widdicombe

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Anton Du Beke and Fred Sirieix attempt to answer 15 questions correctly in the hope of winning one million pounds for charity. They have lifelines including Ask the Host, Phone a Friend and 50-50 available to them if they get stuck. Jeremy Clarkson hosts

programme.title: One Night
programme.desc: Believing Tess to be the author of One Night, Eden tracks her down and asks her about the crime at the heart of the novel. Confused by Eden's claims, Tess is horrified to realise that Simone has written an anonymous novel about the night she was sexually assaulted. Australian drama, starring Jodie Whittaker and Jillian Nguyen

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: English Football League Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the latest matches, including Middlesbrough v Sheffield United at Riverside Stadium, Millwall v Wrexham at The Den and Watford v Southampton at Vicarage Road in the Championship

programme.title: The Twelve
programme.desc: When the jurors are taken to Kate's house to observe a demonstration of the Crown's theory, it ends in disaster for the defence when someone tampers with Kate's studio. Back in the courtroom, an eyewitness testifies that he saw Kate out on the water at 4am the night Claire disappeared

programme.title: Fern Britton: Inside the Vet's
programme.desc: Fern meets a German Shorthaired Pointer puppy who has bitten off more than she can chew and helps vet James with Badger, a handsome but nervous cat who is in for a routine vaccination. Cameras also focus on clinical pet behaviourist Rosie Bescoby, who aims to bring harmony to a pair of warring hounds

programme.title: Simply Raymond Blanc
programme.desc: The chef shares recipes for his favourite dishes, including Swiss chard gratin, duck breast with marmalade, Vichy-style carrots and sweet potato, and artichoke barigoule. programme.title: Ainsley's Fantastic Flavours

Radio presenter Sarah-Jane Crawford then cooks up a storm with her yaki soba before Ainsley's last dish of a refined miso, ginger and yuzu-glazed cod

programme.title: Love Your Small Garden Special
programme.desc: In a special edition of the show, the team transform a narrow backyard in London for charity worker Maxine, and a tiny garden for a family of five in Kent. programme.title: Beat the Chasers

programme.title: I Fought the Law
programme.desc: In 1989, Ann Ming is distraught when her 22-year-old daughter Julie Hogg goes missing, but the police shrug off her concerns, suggesting that she must have fled to London to reunite with her estranged husband.
